Hexxagon.AI

Class BoardState

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hexxagon.AI.BoardState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBoardState

    public final class BoardState
extends Object
implements IBoardState
    Contains the implementation of sate component specified by IBoardState interface. The instance of class represents a state of the board caused by operator apply.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sandor Kalmanchey

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoardState

        public BoardState(byte[][] board,
                  byte actualPlayerIndex)
           throws TError
        Creates a BoardState instance.
        Parameters:
        board - A two dimensional array representing the board table. Value must not be null and each cell must contain one of the allowed values (-1,0,1,2) otherwise TError is thrown.
        actualPlayerIndex - The unique index of player who is allowed to do the ongoing step. Value must be 1 or 2 otherwise TError is thrown.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidBoard

        private static boolean isValidBoard(byte[][] board)
        Answers whether the board is a valid board. A board is valid when: - each cells contains one of the allowed values (-1,0,1,2) - The length and with of array is equal.
        Parameters:
        board - The board which have to be tested.
        Returns:
        True if the board object is a valid one otherwise false.

      • isValidPlayerIndex

        private static boolean isValidPlayerIndex(byte playerIndex)
        Tells whether the player index is a valid one.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The player index to validate.
        Returns:
        True if the player index is valid false, otherwise.

      • isThePlayerHasNoBall

        public final boolean isThePlayerHasNoBall(byte playerIndex)
                                   throws TError
        Answers whether the player has no ball left.
        Specified by:
        isThePlayerHasNoBall in interface IBoardState
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Unique index of player. It must not be in interval of 1-2 otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        True if the specified player has no more ball left on the board otherwise false
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • isCellEmptyAndActive

        public boolean isCellEmptyAndActive(int columnIndex,
                                    int rowIndex)
                             throws TError
        Answers whether the requested cell is an active and not occupied one.
        Specified by:
        isCellEmptyAndActive in interface IBoardState
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The column index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        rowIndex - The row index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        True if specified cell is active and unoccupied otherwise false.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

        public boolean isCellOccupied(int columnIndex,
                              int rowIndex)
                       throws TError
        Answers whether the specified cell is occupied.
        Specified by:

      • getCellValue

        public byte getCellValue(int columnIndex,
                         int rowIndex)
                  throws TError
        Retrieves the value of the specified cell.
        Specified by:
        getCellValue in interface IBoardState
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The column index of the requested cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        rowIndex - The row index of the requested cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        It is "-1" if cell is inactive. It is "0" if cell is active but not occupied. It is "1" if cell is occupied by first player. It is "2" if cell is occupied by second player.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • setCellValue

        public void setCellValue(int columnIndex,
                         int rowIndex,
                         byte fieldValue)
                  throws TError
        Sets the value of the specified cell.
        Specified by:
        setCellValue in interface IBoardState
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The column index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        rowIndex - The row index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        fieldValue - It can be "-1" if cell is inactive or "0" if cell is active but not occupied or "1" if cell is occupied by first player or "2" if cell is occupied by second player. In case of other values TError is thrown.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.
